newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: GOLF-ROCCA'S RYDER CUP PLACE UNDER THREAT.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-ROCCA'S RYDER CUP PLACE UNDER THREAT.

text.p: Italy's Costantino Rocca, lying in a vulnerable ninth place on the European Ryder Cup table, missed the halfway cut in the Czech Open after the storm-interrupted second round finished off following a further delay on Saturday morning.

The Italian had gone to bed on Friday knowing his two-under-par 140 total might be one worse than the qualifying mark, and his worst fear was realised when the last 36 players finished off after a two-hour holdup because of fog.

Rocca can now be overtaken on the Cup table by one of the leaders here, Ignacio Garrido of Spain, who holds the 10th the final automatic position in Europe's current rankings with this event and three more to count before selection.

Garrido is in a three-way tie for the lead on 11-under-par 131 with compatriot Miguel Jimenez and Sweden's Patrick Sjoland, who broke the course record with a 10-under-par 61 on Friday before a storm forced an early halt in play.
They are one ahead of first-round leader Scott Henderson of Scotland, who completed a second-round 68.
